children.docstring: - **Path**: `/api/auth/login` - **Method**: `POST` - **Description**: Authenticate using email and password, returns JWT access and refresh tokens

children.name: Logout

children.name: Custom Channel Plugin Development

symbols.docstring: OpenClaw already has a mature channel adapter architecture with support for Slack, Discord, MS Teams, Google Chat, Signal, Telegram, WhatsApp, iMessag
symbols.name: 3. OpenClaw Channel Capabilities

children.docstring: Each tenant's OpenClaw container connects directly to Slack/Teams/Discord using native channel adapters.
children.name: Option A: OpenClaw Instance Per Tenant (Direct Channel Connection)

children.docstring: Build all channel adapters as NestJS modules in Aegis. Use OpenClaw only as a skill/LLM execution engine via REST.
children.name: Option B: Aegis Gateway Only (No OpenClaw Channels)

children.docstring: Multiple tenants share a pool of stateless OpenClaw workers. Aegis routes messages to any available worker.
children.name: Option C: Shared OpenClaw Pool (Multi-Tenant)

children.docstring: A hybrid architecture where: 1. One Slack App / Teams App / Discord Bot (shared, multi-workspace capable) 2. Aegis Channel Proxy (NestJS) handles all
children.name: Option D: Aegis Channel Proxy + Per-Tenant OpenClaw + Aegis Channel Plugin (APPROVED)

children.docstring: The critical bridge piece. A single custom OpenClaw channel plugin installed in every tenant container. It does NOT handle Slack/Teams/Discord directl
children.name: 5.2 The Aegis Channel Plugin (OpenClaw Side)

children.docstring: Within each tenant's OpenClaw container, the multi-agent-plan.md 3-layer architecture applies:
children.name: 5.3 Multi-Agent Routing Within a Tenant

children.docstring: When a message arrives at the Aegis Channel Proxy, it resolves the target agent using three strategies in priority order:
children.name: 5.4 Routing Strategy (Proxy Side)

symbols.docstring: Use a **single shared gateway** with multiple agents routed via `bindings`. Each colleague gets their own Telegram bot, workspace, and session isolati
symbols.name: TL;DR

children.docstring: One OpenClaw instance running multiple agents via `agents.list[]` + `bindings[]`.
children.name: Option A: Shared Gateway (Recommended ✅)

children.docstring: Each person runs their own OpenClaw gateway.
children.name: Option B: Isolated Instances (Separate Servers)

children.docstring: **Go with Option A.** OpenClaw is designed for multi-agent on a single gateway. The isolation is strong (separate workspaces, separate sessions, confi
children.name: Verdict

children.docstring: Each colleague gets their own Telegram bot via BotFather. This is the cleanest approach.
children.name: Telegram: One Bot Per Person (Recommended ✅)

children.name: Shared Bot (Not Recommended)

children.docstring: "Audit service, global interceptor, async BullMQ writer"
children.name: description

children.name: description

children.name: description

children.name: description

children.docstring: "Audit module unit tests, interceptor integration tests"
children.name: description

children.docstring: "Audit interceptor adds latency to API responses"
children.name: risk

children.docstring: "Async write via BullMQ -- interceptor only enqueues, never awaits DB write"
children.name: mitigation

children.docstring: "Batch inserts, partitioned table by month, indexes only on query-critical columns"
children.name: mitigation

children.docstring: "Structured inter-agent messaging API with allowlist enforcement"
children.name: description

children.name: description

children.name: description

children.docstring: "BullMQ priority queues; Redis caching for allowlist lookups"
children.name: mitigation

children.docstring: "E11-F1 is data model + skeleton (low risk); devops handles independently"
children.name: mitigation

children.docstring: "Skill permission manifests with validation and runtime logging"
children.name: description

children.docstring: "Channel proxy core: tenant resolution, routing engine, session mgmt, outbound dispatch"
children.name: description

children.docstring: "Channel proxy + security in same sprint is ambitious (34pts)"
children.name: risk

children.docstring: "Proxy and security are independent workstreams; different engineers"
children.name: mitigation

children.docstring: "Use React Flow (higher-level abstraction); table fallback always available"
children.name: mitigation

children.docstring: "Auto-generate permissive manifests from current permissions JSONB"
children.name: mitigation

children.docstring: "Slack App: OAuth flow, Socket Mode, events, slash commands, outbound delivery"
children.name: description

children.docstring: "E7-F3 (8pts) is frontend-only, independent of backend Slack work"
children.name: mitigation

children.docstring: "Use Socket Mode (no public URL needed); submit app early"
children.name: mitigation

children.docstring: "Publish to private npm registry first; public npm in Phase 3"
children.name: mitigation

children.docstring: "Microsoft Teams App: M365 Agents SDK, consent flow, personal/channel messages, proactive"
children.name: description

children.docstring: "Discord Bot: OAuth, slash commands, guild messages, DMs, proactive"
children.name: description

children.docstring: "Azure Bot Service simplifies; test with dev tenant first"
children.name: mitigation

children.docstring: "E11-F4 and E11-F5 developed in parallel by different engineers; E9-F2 is devops track"

symbols.name: Executive Summary

children.name: Media Coverage

children.docstring: **Attack Vector:** 1. Victim clicks malicious link 2. JavaScript steals gateway auth token via cross-site WebSocket hijacking 3. Attacker connects to
children.name: 2.1 CVE-2026-25253 — Token Hijacking / RCE

children.docstring: **Attack Vector:** - Malicious instructions hidden in emails, web pages, documents - Agent reads content → executes adversarial instructions - Can lea
children.name: 2.2 Prompt Injection Attacks

children.docstring: **Attack Vector:** - Publicly accessible OpenClaw instances without authentication - Plaintext API keys in config files - Conversation histories expos
children.name: 2.3 Exposed Credentials & Misconfiguration

children.docstring: **Attack Vector:** - Skills contain hidden malicious instructions - Data exfiltration via curl/network calls - Command injection via embedded bash - T
children.name: 2.4 Malicious Skills

children.docstring: **Attack Vector:** - OpenClaw can run shell commands, read/write files, execute scripts - Misconfigured or compromised agent = full system access - Da
children.name: 2.5 System-Level Privileges

children.docstring: **Attack Vector:** - Employees install OpenClaw without security review - Agents introduced to corporate environments - No visibility into agent capab
children.name: 2.6 Shadow AI / Supply Chain Risk

symbols.docstring: This document lists API endpoints that exist in the API contract but are **not directly represented** in the current 18 UI screens. These endpoints ar
symbols.name: Overview

children.docstring: **Endpoint:** `PATCH /api/admin/tenants/:id` **Description:** Update tenant configuration (plan, limits, model defaults)
children.name: Update Tenant Config

children.docstring: **Endpoint:** `DELETE /api/admin/tenants/:id` **Description:** Decommission tenant (soft delete with 7-day grace period)
children.name: Delete Tenant

children.docstring: **Endpoint:** `GET /api/admin/tenants/:id/health` **Description:** Detailed container health metrics with 24h history
children.name: Get Tenant Container Health (Historical)

children.docstring: **Endpoint:** `GET /api/admin/tenants/:id/agents` **Description:** List all agents within a tenant
children.name: Get Tenant Agents

children.docstring: **Endpoint:** `GET /api/admin/skills` **Description:** All published skills with admin metrics
children.name: List Published Skills (Admin View)

children.docstring: **Endpoint:** `PATCH /api/dashboard/agents/:id` **Description:** Update agent configuration (model tier, thinking mode, tool policy)
children.name: Update Agent

children.docstring: **Endpoint:** `GET /api/dashboard/agents/:id/activity` **Description:** Paginated activity log for specific agent
children.name: Get Agent Activity Feed

children.docstring: **Endpoint:** `GET /api/dashboard/agents/:id/logs` **Description:** Agent logs with filtering (debug, info, warn, error)
children.name: Get Agent Logs

children.docstring: **Endpoint:** `GET /api/dashboard/skills/installed` **Description:** List all skills installed for tenant
children.name: Get Installed Skills

children.docstring: **Endpoint:** `GET /api/dashboard/audit/export?format=csv|json` **Description:** Export audit log as CSV or JSON
children.name: Export Audit Log
